ai.summary: A short and easy 1.9 km walk in the UK. Suitable for families and casual walkers, it follows well-maintained paths with gentle gradients and pleasant surroundings.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently undulating terrain on well-trodden paths. Some sections may be packed dirt or grass; watch for uneven surfaces and seasonal mud.
ai.safety_notes: General safety: stay on marked paths and follow local signage. Check the weather forecast before you go and be prepared for sudden changes in the UK climate. Wear sturdy, comfortable footwear and bring a light layer and rain protection. Carry water and a small snack, your phone, and a map or offline navigation. Keep dogs under control and on a short leash where required. Be mindful of other pedestrians, cyclists, and wildlife, and watch for wet leaves or mud, especially after rain. If you’re hiking alone, let someone know your route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy, comfortable walking shoes or boots
Lightweight waterproof jacket and an extra layer
Map, guidebook, or offline navigation app
Fully charged phone and a portable power bank
Compact rain cover for your bag
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) for milder, drier conditions; the walk is still doable in winter with warm clothing and proper footing.

seo.title: Mesopotamia Walk - Easy 1.9 km hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Mesopotamia Walk: a short, easy 1.9 km hike in the UK suitable for families and casual walkers. Practical safety tips and gear included.
